body_html:
Have I written custom code: N/A
OS Platform and Distribution: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-116-generic x86_64)
TensorFlow installed from: Both using conda as well as bazel build whl package inside conda env
Bazel version: 0.12 and 0.11 in individual tries
CUDA/cuDNN version: CUDA 9.0 cuDNN 1.7
GPU model and memory: 2 Tesla K80's (see the nvidia-smi output shown in the question)
Exact command to reproduce:

import tensorflow as tf
tf.Session()

tf.Session() causes the error

Hope this information is adequate.

body:
**Have I written custom code**: N/A
**OS Platform and Distribution**: Ubuntu 16.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 4.4.0-116-generic x86_64)
**TensorFlow installed from**: Both using conda as well as bazel build whl package inside conda env
**Bazel version**: 0.12 and 0.11 in individual tries
**CUDA/cuDNN version**: CUDA 9.0 cuDNN 1.7
**GPU model and memory**: 2 Tesla K80's (see the nvidia-smi output shown in the question)
**Exact command to reproduce**:
```
import tensorflow as tf
tf.Session()
```
tf.Session() causes the error

Hope this information is adequate.
